items.content_html:
Summary

I have updated the spec_url links to point to draft.csswg.org/

Test results and supporting details

N/A

Related issues

N/A

Summary

Edge appears to support 103 Early Hints from WPT, I presume from same version as Chrome (it's not noted at all in the Edge release notes)

Test results and supporting details

https://wpt.fyi/results/loading/early-hints?label=experimental&label=master&aligned

You can also see it working from this test, where the fonts load early:
https://www.webpagetest.org/result/221213_BiDcDR_DN3/1/details/

Related issues
items.title: Update Edge to support 103 Early Hints

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates the compact data for the Local Font Access API:

  • The API features were already there, but the data was slightly wrong (the API is currently available only on Chromium desktop, not mobile).
  • I also added data points for the local-fonts Permissions Policy header directive, and Permissions API permission.

See my research document for more details of exactly what the larger work involves: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1q1p_wlMe67LYvSuwbTZDOuL0csfG2rw_3qT2ROpC2sY/edit#

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: update local font access API data

items.content_html:
This PR adds Media Session actions to BCD for a better granularity. Even though setActionHandler() is exposed, new actions are added overtime.

I was able to get releases numbers with resources below:

  • https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/source/dom/media/mediacontrol/MediaControlUtils.h#55
  • https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/blob/c1c0e7fbede03d23c5191147fbd385498a289301/Source/WebCore/Modules/mediasession/MediaSessionAction.idl
  • https://chromestatus.com/features#media%20session
items.title: Add MediaSession actions types

items.content_html:
Summary

Adding BCD for the Text fragments feature. There's not much in this PR, as most of the required features were already present.

See my research document for more information on what data is needed.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: add data for text fragments

items.content_html:
The scrollend event indicates scrolling is complete inside the Document or inside scrollable elements.

Bugs:

  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1797013

Related issues and pull requests:

  • Content PR mdn/content#22894
  • Parent issue mdn/content#22814

Support details:

  • Fx:
    • 108 behind pref apz.scrollend-event.content.enabled
    • 109 pref apz.scrollend-event.content.enabled set to true by default
  • Chrome:
    • 110 behind CL flag use --enable-blink-features=OverscrollCustomization (see platform status page)
items.title: releases(API): Fx 109 enables scrollend event by default which indicates scroll is complete

items.content_html:
Adding the declarativeNetRequest API.

Complement the content addition in #22644

  • core content
  • confirm core content release versions
  • add detail for additions and deprecations
items.title: Add declarativeNetRequest

items.content_html:
Summary

Add support for start and end on align-items for Safari 16.

Test results and supporting details

Navigate to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items in Chrome (107.0.5304.110) and Safari (16). Visually compare behavior of Results section.

Compared values:

  • normal
  • flex-start
  • flex-end
  • start
  • end

Screenshot of Safari 16 with one of the aforementioned values:

As for existing bug reports, I didn't find anything specific to align-items -- I will admit I am not acquainted with searching for bugs in webkit. A a comment in a similar report mentions that many flexbox bugs were fixed by Feb 2022.

Related issues
items.title: Safari supports `start` and `end`

items.content_html:
Summary

Chrome 109 sees the Origin Private File System features of the File System API enabled in Chrome Android and WebView. This PR makes those updates.

See my research document for more details on the changes made: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rPYCw13kIrTnSvUaStCoDFTyeYHXy7tgykiumnccGTI/edit#

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Update Chrome Android and WebView data for OPFS features

items.content_html:
Summary

overflow-wrap: anywhere is now supported in Safari (https://twitter.com/jensimmons/status/1515042940783104002). It should be from Safari 15.4 according to #17012 (comment).

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #17012
items.title: Add Safari support for `overflow-wrap: anywhere`

items.content_html:
Summary

These changes were generated procedurally by the mdn-bcd-collector project [1] using data collected from Chrome for Android [2].

[1] https://github.com/foolip/mdn-bcd-collector
commit 06ea2714451c548934849011e4106b3175adfab5
[2] https://github.com/foolip/mdn-bcd-results
commit f37e6db1da24143bf039ed8e269c9f234d2b4e90

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

This changeset is based on the one originally submitted via #17908. It uses compatibility data which has been collected since that patch was created, and it includes only a subset of the changes generated by the mdn-bcd-collector.
items.title: Update support data for Chrome Android (API's T through Z)

items.content_html:
Summary

#18278 somehow missed this. https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/MIDIInputMap/@@iterator says it's supported in Firefox, so not sure if it was a tooling bug or something.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Fix missing Firefox version number for MIDIInputMap.@@iterator

items.content_html:
Summary

The keepalive parameter to the Fetch (and Request) API is still not supported by Firefox and this is likely to catch people out.

This PR grabs the fetch param data from the Request API to make this clearer (located in api/Request.json).

Test results and supporting details

Symlinked build dir into mdn/content and checked build.

Related issues
items.title: Add fetch keepalive compat data

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the various Audio APIs, based upon results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0 + v7.1.0).

Tests Used:
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/AudioContext
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/AudioDestinationNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/AudioNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/BaseAudioContext
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/BiquadFilterNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/DynamicsCompressorNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/MediaStreamAudioDestinationNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/WaveShaperNode

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Update Chromium versions for Audio APIs

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing slotchange_event member of the ShadowRoot API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/ShadowRoot/slotchange_event

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add missing api.ShadowRoot.slotchange_event feature

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing [dis]connect_event member of the Serial API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/Serial/[dis]connect_event

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add missing api.Serial.[dis]connect_event feature
